summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 between federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of New Mexico. It discusses coordination regarding investigations into Jeffrey Epstein's activities and property in New Mexico, specifically noting an agreement with the New Mexico Attorney General's office to cease its sex trafficking investigation in favor of the federal probe.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: An Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) copied on the email chain, involved in coordinating with New Mexico authorities regarding the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jonathon Gerson
persons.role: Attorney, Fraud and Public Corruption Section
persons.context: An attorney from the Fraud and Public Corruption Section of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of New Mexico, corresponding with SDNY prosecutors to schedule a call about Epstein's New Mexico conduct and property.

persons.name: Hector Balderas
persons.context: The New Mexico Attorney General, quoted in a news article as stating his office is conducting a state-level criminal investigation into Epstein 'in coordination with' the SDNY.

persons.name: Stephanie Garcia Richard
persons.context: The New Mexico State Land Commissioner who revoked grazing leases held by Epstein's company, Cypress Inc., on state trust land.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: A colleague of the SDNY prosecutor on the Epstein case, copied on the email chain to help schedule a coordination call.

persons.name: Holland S. Kastrin
persons.context: An attorney with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of New Mexico (USANM), included in the email correspondence regarding scheduling the follow-up call.

connections.description: Corresponding to schedule a call between the SDNY and New Mexico U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein investigation.
The New Mexico AG's office agreed to cease its sex trafficking investigation and share information with the SDNY, indicating a coordinated investigative relationship.
The State Land Commissioner notified the Attorney General about the lease cancellations and potential criminal activity on the Epstein property.

events.title: Agreement with NM AG's Office
events.description: The SDNY prosecutors spoke with the New Mexico Attorney General's office, which agreed to cease its investigation into sex trafficking and share gathered information with the SDNY.

events.title: Lease Revocation for Epstein's NM Property
events.description: New Mexico State Land Commissioner Stephanie Garcia Richard revoked grazing leases held by Epstein's company, Cypress Inc., on state trust land.

events.title: Scheduled Coordination Call
events.description: A phone call was scheduled between the SDNY and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of New Mexico to discuss Epstein's New Mexico conduct and property.

keyFacts: In July 2019, the New Mexico Attorney General's office agreed to cease its investigation into sex trafficking related to Epstein and share its information with the SDNY.
New Mexico State Land Commissioner Stephanie Garcia Richard revoked state grazing leases held by Epstein's company, Cypress Inc., in September 2019.
New Mexico Attorney General Hector Balderas stated his office was conducting a state-level criminal investigation 'in coordination with' the SDNY.
The email chain shows active coordination and scheduling between federal prosecutors in New York and New Mexico regarding the Epstein investigation in September 2019.
The SDNY agreed to share any information about state crimes committed in New Mexico with the state AG's office at the conclusion of the federal case.
